trans-unit.source: Set Performance Settings of an Elastic Database Pool
trans-unit.target: Set Performance Settings of an Elastic Database Pool

trans-unit.source: Updates the performance settings of an Azure SQL Database elastic database pool.
trans-unit.target: Updates the performance settings of an Azure SQL Database elastic database pool.

trans-unit.source: The only properties of an existing elastic pool that can be changed are its pool DTUs, DTU min per database, and DTU max per database.
trans-unit.target: The only properties of an existing elastic pool that can be changed are its pool DTUs, DTU min per database, and DTU max per database.

trans-unit.source: In order to ensure a valid combination of performance setting changes even if the change request fails, the following must be true: (𝑛𝑢𝑚𝑏𝑒𝑟 𝑜𝑓 𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑎𝑏𝑎𝑠𝑒𝑠 𝑐𝑢𝑟𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑙𝑦 𝑖𝑛 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑝𝑜𝑜𝑙 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝑎𝑛𝑦 𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑎𝑏𝑎𝑠𝑒𝑠 𝑏𝑒𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑎𝑑𝑑𝑒𝑑 𝑡𝑜 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑝𝑜𝑜𝑙)∙max(𝑐𝑢𝑟𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑡 𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑎𝑏𝑎𝑠𝑒𝐷𝑡𝑢𝑀𝑖𝑛,𝑟𝑒𝑞𝑢𝑒𝑠𝑡𝑒𝑑 𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑎𝑏𝑎𝑠𝑒𝐷𝑡𝑢𝑀𝑖𝑛) ≤ min(𝑐𝑢𝑟𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑡 𝑝𝑜𝑜𝑙 𝐷𝑡𝑢,𝑟𝑒𝑞𝑢𝑒𝑠𝑡𝑒𝑑 𝑝𝑜𝑜𝑙 𝐷𝑡𝑢)
trans-unit.target: In order to ensure a valid combination of performance setting changes even if the change request fails, the following must be true: (𝑛𝑢𝑚𝑏𝑒𝑟 𝑜𝑓 𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑎𝑏𝑎𝑠𝑒𝑠 𝑐𝑢𝑟𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑙𝑦 𝑖𝑛 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑝𝑜𝑜𝑙 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝑎𝑛𝑦 𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑎𝑏𝑎𝑠𝑒𝑠 𝑏𝑒𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑎𝑑𝑑𝑒𝑑 𝑡𝑜 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑝𝑜𝑜𝑙)∙max(𝑐𝑢𝑟𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑡 𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑎𝑏𝑎𝑠𝑒𝐷𝑡𝑢𝑀𝑖𝑛,𝑟𝑒𝑞𝑢𝑒𝑠𝑡𝑒𝑑 𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑎𝑏𝑎𝑠𝑒𝐷𝑡𝑢𝑀𝑖𝑛) ≤ min(𝑐𝑢𝑟𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑡 𝑝𝑜𝑜𝑙 𝐷𝑡𝑢,𝑟𝑒𝑞𝑢𝑒𝑠𝑡𝑒𝑑 𝑝𝑜𝑜𝑙 𝐷𝑡𝑢)

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="1d63f105-1661-48b5-82c8-66b3b80ceb92#sqlrestcommon" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all SQL Database requests.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="1d63f105-1661-48b5-82c8-66b3b80ceb92#sqlrestcommon" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Common parameters and headers</link> for headers and parameters that are used by all SQL Database requests.

trans-unit.source: To determine if the elastic pool is available, use <link xlink:href="e14f9b46-a6d6-42ea-ac28-c5b493b1c790" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Status of Elastic Pool Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: To determine if the elastic pool is available, use <link xlink:href="e14f9b46-a6d6-42ea-ac28-c5b493b1c790" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Status of Elastic Pool Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the required and optional request headers:
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the required and optional request headers:

trans-unit.source: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit.
trans-unit.target: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit.

trans-unit.source: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.
trans-unit.target: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.

trans-unit.source: The format of the request body is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The format of the request body is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements of the request body.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements of the request body.

trans-unit.source: Data center location of the server containing the elastic pool.
trans-unit.target: Data center location of the server containing the elastic pool.

trans-unit.source: Service tier of the elastic pool.
trans-unit.target: Service tier of the elastic pool.

trans-unit.source: Or both parameters can be set.
trans-unit.target: Or both parameters can be set.

trans-unit.source: If both parameters are set, then they must be consistent with the DTU and storage allowance allocated to the service tier, otherwise the request is rejected.
trans-unit.target: If both parameters are set, then they must be consistent with the DTU and storage allowance allocated to the service tier, otherwise the request is rejected.

trans-unit.source: Or both parameters can be set.
trans-unit.target: Or both parameters can be set.

trans-unit.source: If both parameters are set, then they must be consistent with the DTU and storage allowance allocated to the service tier, otherwise the request is rejected.
trans-unit.target: If both parameters are set, then they must be consistent with the DTU and storage allowance allocated to the service tier, otherwise the request is rejected.

trans-unit.source: Minimum number of DTUs that a single database in the elastic pool is guaranteed.
trans-unit.target: Minimum number of DTUs that a single database in the elastic pool is guaranteed.

trans-unit.source: The database DTU min may be set to 0.
trans-unit.target: The database DTU min may be set to 0.

trans-unit.source: The DTU min is the same for all databases in the pool.
trans-unit.target: The DTU min is the same for all databases in the pool.

trans-unit.source: Maximum number of DTUs that a single database in the elastic pool may use.
trans-unit.target: Maximum number of DTUs that a single database in the elastic pool may use.

trans-unit.source: The database DTU max is not a resource guarantee.
trans-unit.target: The database DTU max is not a resource guarantee.

trans-unit.source: The DTU max is the same for all databases in the pool.
trans-unit.target: The DTU max is the same for all databases in the pool.

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the database management service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the database management service.

trans-unit.source: This request id is used for request tracking.
trans-unit.target: This request id is used for request tracking.

trans-unit.source: If a failure occurs that requires the user to contact <externalLink><linkText>Microsoft Support</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=1782</linkUri></externalLink>, the request id should be provided to Microsoft to assist in tracking and resolving the failure for the request.
trans-unit.target: If a failure occurs that requires the user to contact <externalLink><linkText>Microsoft Support</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=1782</linkUri></externalLink>, the request id should be provided to Microsoft to assist in tracking and resolving the failure for the request.
